Hi Radioman!

We're using WPF+.NetFW4+PRISM4 in order to build a WPF based standalone app. Now when we're merging all our PRISMV4 modules together my module containing a GMAP control has started to behave badly. It starts to spontaneously change the zoom level and furthermore is the current position changed. I remember from a previous discussion with you that I needed to include the following in order to have GMAP support .NetFW4:

  <startup useLegacyV2RuntimeActivationPolicy="true">
    <supportedRuntime version="v4.0" sku=".NETFramework,Version=v4.0"/>
  </startup>

and I've placed that entry immediately after the <configSections/> section in App.config. Is there anything else I need to do to make this strange behavior disappear? The version of GMap I use is "greatmaps_5866b20195bb". I believe it was released in late 2010.

Many thanks for an excellent piece of work. It truly is a work of art - in a word: "Mastery":)
/Peter
...i don't know about old versions, but current version doesn't need any configs, and what do you mean 'merge', few dlls into one?
